abstract: Terrance Hale is found guilty of first-degree assault and other charges for stabbing officer Eder Loor of the New York City police in 2012; will face minimum of 10 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: Terrance Hale, 29, who has a history of schizophrenia, faces a minimum of 10 years in prison and could face up to 25 years.

headline.main: Harlem Man Is Found Guilty of Assault for Stabbing Officer in the Head
headline.print_headline: Man Is Found Guilty of Assault for Stabbing Officer in the Head

snippet: Terrance Hale, 29, who has a history of schizophrenia, faces a minimum of 10 years in prison and could face up to 25 years.
